oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Vidette newspaper
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Vidette was published by Gen. John Hunt Morgan in Hartsville, Tenn. during the war. The headlines include: "Outrages Committed at Gallatin,"Proclamation from Morgan Brigade " the satirical "Federal Mother's Lullaby,"The Kentucky Battle Song," and a notice reminding citizens not to sell liquor to soldiers. This issue is special because it was Vol. 1, No. 1. Morgan recruited publisher Gordon E. Niles into the 2nd Ky. Cav. Regt., CSA. Lt. Niles was killed in battle at Edgefild Junction, Tenn.
